item.title: Feb-12 election not for opportunists: Jamaat Ameer
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami Ameer Dr Shafiqur Rahman on Sunday said the upcoming election is meant to bring liberation to hardworking common people, not benefit opportunists. In a Facebook post, he said politics in Bangladesh has become a breeding ground for corruption and illegal privileges, adding that poli

item.title: Iran insists on right to enrichment, ready for confidence-building
item.description: Recognition of Iran's right to enrich uranium is key for nuclear talks with the US to succeed, Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Sunday. American and Iranian diplomats held indirect talks in Oman on Friday, aimed at reviving diplomacy amid a US naval buildup near Iran and Tehran's vows of a h

item.title: Midland Bank organises Annual Agent Banking Conference 2026
item.description: Midland Bank PLC organized the Annual Agent Banking Conference 2026 at Six Seasons Hotel, Gulshan, Dhaka, on 7 February 2026. Md. Ahsan-uz Zaman, Managing Director and CEO of the bank, inaugurated the daylong conference as the chief guest and presided over the conference, according to a media rele

item.title: Bangladesh Bank limits financial transactions ahead of elections
item.description: Bangladesh Bank has issued new instructions to reduce the cash transaction limit ahead of the upcoming general election. Transactions of more than Tk 10,000 per day cannot be made using mobile financial services (MFS) until midnight on election day, Feb 12. The central bank sent the instructions

item.title: Tarique pledges ‘safe cities’
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman has promised to build a “safe Dhaka” and add 40 playgrounds to the city if elected. He made the promises while speaking at a rally at the ECB Chattar in Mirpur under the Dhaka-17 constituency around 3:45pm, after launching his election campaign in Dhaka. &l

item.title: Planning commission gets new member
item.description: The government on Sunday transferred Md Mahmudul Hussain Khan, secretary attached to the Chief Adviser’s Office, to the Planning Commission as a member (secretary). The public administration ministry has issued a notification signed by deputy secretary Mohammad Rafiqul Haque in this regard.

item.title: Election Commission dismisses social media ‘rumours’ of poll suspension
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has urged the public to pay no attention to “rumours” that the parliamentary election is being suspended. The request was made in a statement issued on Sunday and signed by Ruhul Amin Mollick, director of the EC’s public relations wing. It said, &ldq

item.title: Minority issues must be treated as national concerns to sustain democracy: CGS
item.description: Speakers at a report launching event on Sunday said minority concerns must be treated as national issues to sustain democracy in the country. They said the rule of law has been dragged onto the streets through mob pressure, while manifestos have no real value without accountability. Gaps in overs

item.title: Gunmen kill three people and abduct Catholic priest in northern Nigeria
item.description: Gunmen killed three people and abducted a Catholic priest and several others during an early morning attack on the clergyman’s residence in northern Nigeria’s Kaduna state, church and police sources said on Sunday. Saturday’s assault in the Kauru district highlights persistent in

item.title: ICC delegation in Lahore for India-Pak match talks
item.description: A high-level delegation from the International Cricket Council (ICC) is scheduled to arrive in Lahore on Sunday evening for urgent crisis talks with the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), following the government's directive to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. The president of Bangladesh

item.title: Bangladesh, UK strengthen defence partnership with survey vessel sales deal
item.description: Bangladesh Navy and the United Kingdom have signed a government‑to‑government sales agreement for the former HMS Enterprise, an Echo‑class hydrographic and oceanographic survey vessel. The sale of the HMS Enterprise highlights the UK’s continued partnership with Bangladesh in enhancing marit

item.title: Aviation advisor defends role as Biman chief
item.description: Civil Aviation and Tourism Advisor Sheikh Bashir Uddin has defended his appointment as chairman of the board of Biman Bangladesh Airlines, saying the move does not breach any laws and has precedent.
